attributes.action: The culling of pigeons in the City of London.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that there are half a million cats living in London, roughly two pigeons per cat. 
They have feet and wings, which pretty much make them invincible. Anywhere I can go, they can go faster.
Having moved to London two years ago, I've noticed that the pigeons specifically in London are more destructive, remorseless and unruly.
I can no longer go to parks, markets, rivers or open spaces with food around. They cull the monkeys in Gibraltar, we should do the same for pigeons!
attributes.background:
Pigeons are taking over the City of London, you physically cannot escape them. For someone like myself, who has sever ornithophobia (a fear of pigeons), I am unable to feel safe in my own City! 
They are flying rats in the sky, who carry and spread diseases as well as terrorise citizens.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Pest control in London is a matter for individual local authorities.
